Types

BackOff = enum
  fixed, exponential
RetryError = object of CatchableError
RetryPolicy = object
  delay*: Duration           ## Time to wait after the attempt.
  maxDelay*: Duration        ## Maximum delay.
  jitter*: bool              ## Randomly delay. if true.
  backOff*: BackOff          ## Fix or increase the wait time after an attempt.
  exponent*: int             ## Increase delay exponentially with each attempt.
                             ## Ignored if `backoff.fixed`.
  maxRetries*: int           ## Maximum attempts,
  logLevel*: Level           ## Log level.
  failLog*: bool             ## Show logs if fails. You need to create a logger before retry.
  customFailLog*: string     ## If you used custom logs use this.

Consts

DefaultRetryPolicy = (delay: (seconds: 0, nanosecond: 100000000),
                      maxDelay: (seconds: 1, nanosecond: 0), jitter: false,
                      backOff: fixed, exponent: 2, maxRetries: 3,
                      logLevel: lvlInfo, failLog: true, customFailLog: "")

Macros

macro retryIf(policy: RetryPolicy; body: typed; conditions: untyped): untyped

Retry only if the result of body matches the conditions.

A r variable can be used implicitly in retryIf. It's assigned the result of body and is available in the conditions.

Example:

assert 2 == retryIf(1 + 1, r != 2)
macro retryIfAsync(policy: RetryPolicy; body: typed; conditions: untyped): untyped
Return an async proc.

Example:

import std/asyncdispatch

let p = DefaultRetryPolicy

proc sleepAndReturnInt(t: int): Future[int] {.async.} =
  await sleepAsync t
  return t

assert 1 == waitFor retryIfAsync(p, sleepAndReturnInt(1), r != 1)
macro retryIfException(policy: RetryPolicy; body: typed;
                       exceptions: varargs[untyped]): untyped
Retry only if the result of body matches exceptions.

Example:

let p = DefaultRetryPolicy
retryIfException(p, assert true, AssertionDefect)
macro retryIfExceptionAsync(policy: RetryPolicy; asyncProc: typed;
                            exceptions: varargs[untyped]): untyped
Return an async proc.

Example:

import std/asyncdispatch

let p = DefaultRetryPolicy

waitFor retryIfExceptionAsync(p, sleepAsync(1), ValueError)

Templates

template retry(body: untyped): untyped
Use DefaultRetryPolicy.

Example:

retry:
  assert true
template retry(policy: RetryPolicy; body: untyped): untyped
Attempts received body according to RetryPolicy. Returns the result of the last body if it fails (CatchableError or Defect) after trying up to the maximum number of times.

Example:

let p = DefaultRetryPolicy
retry p:
  assert true
template retryAsync(body: untyped): untyped
Use DefaultRetryPolicy.

Example:

import std/asyncdispatch

proc sleepAsyncRetry(t: int): Future[void] {.async.} =
  retryAsync:
    await sleepAsync t

waitFor sleepAsyncRetry(1000)
template retryAsync(policy: RetryPolicy; body: untyped): untyped
Use sleepAsync.

Example:

import std/asyncdispatch

let p = DefaultRetryPolicy

proc sleepAsyncRetry(t: int): Future[void] {.async.} =
  retryAsync p:
    await sleepAsync t

waitFor sleepAsyncRetry(1000)
template retryIf(body: typed; conditions: untyped): untyped
Use DefaultRetryPolicy.

Example:

let p = DefaultRetryPolicy
assert 2 == retryIf(p, 1 + 1, r != 2)
template retryIfAsync(asyncProc: typed; conditions: untyped): untyped
Use DefaultRetryPolicy.

Example:

import std/asyncdispatch

proc sleepAndReturnInt(t: int): Future[int] {.async.} =
  await sleepAsync t
  return t

assert 1 == waitFor retryIfAsync(sleepAndReturnInt(1), r != 1)
template retryIfException(body: untyped; exceptions: varargs[untyped]): untyped
Use DefaultRetryPolicy.

Example:

retryIfException(assert true, AssertionDefect)
template retryIfExceptionAsync(asyncProc: untyped; exceptions: varargs[untyped]): untyped
Use DefaultRetryPolicy.

Example:

import std/asyncdispatch

waitFor retryIfExceptionAsync(sleepAsync(1), ValueError)
